_source.text: About half of the survey respondents felt that certain grapes did better than the others in 2013, but answers varied from Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and a number of other varietals.

_source.text: 2010 Chateau Villotte, Bordeaux Supérieur, 2010 ($13.99) - Even better than the 2009 that we carried last year, the 2010 Villotte is a classic Bordeaux made in the style of a St.-Emilion with 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon.

text: 2010 Chateau Villotte, Bordeaux Supérieur, 2010 ($13.99) - Even **better** **than** the 2009 that we carried last year, the 2010 Villotte is a classic Bordeaux made in the style of a St.-Emilion with 80% **Merlot** and 20% **Cabernet** **Sauvignon**.

_source.text: 30 Second Wine Tasting Tip: How 75% can be better than 100% Which would you rather drink: A wine that's made 100 percent from a single grape variety like Cabernet Sauvignon, Chardonnay or Merlot ... or one made from a blend of more than one grape?
